text: my job here is to ride take care of and
work with the horses here in the barn my
name's specialist Benjamin noms I've
been in the yo guard for approximately
two and a half years I'm a member of the
third United States infantry regiment
the old guard caisson platoon originally
when I joined I had not planned on
coming to the old guard shortly after I
got through meps my uncle was actually
killed in Iraq and is buried here in the
cemetery and I came up here for his
funeral and I saw everything that
happened here and then shortly after
that I got the chance when I was the
30th AG to sign up for the old guard and
so I took it to me the old guard is it's
about respect and honor for fallen
comrades fallen brothers and sisters
whether they died in combat or whether
they've been out of service for a while
they've all everybody this buried and
Arlington Cemetery deserves to be very
darling cemetery you know it's art it's
our last chance to give them respect
they've earned so for me it's a great
honor there's a lot of pride that goes
with serving in this unit
